{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3566077,"name":"Mike Stitt","username":"stittrm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stittrm/{size}/175198_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T16:45:23.958Z","cooked":"

We’d like to reduce our backlash on our arm joint from this pulley

The Thrifty Bot

QTY 1 - 24 Tooth HTD Pulley 1/2" Hex Bore

This 5M HTD aluminum pulley will allow teams to create belt reductions and drive mechanisms with a common 1/2" hex interface. We focused on robustness and tested them thoroughly during the 2024 season to ensure the flanges do not pop off during use....

Price: USD 12.99

to our steel 1/2 inch hex shaft.

image1790×1356 98.7 KB

Our approach is based upon:

RustHOUNDS Ri3D 2025 Robot in 3 Days (RI3D)
[image] Hello FRC Community! We are excited to announce that FRC team 868, the TechHOUNDS, will be fielding an Ri3D team this year composed of our alumni, the RustHOUNDS! Our Goals Starting at kickoff, we will be releasing periodic updates about our team’s approach to this year’s game, as well as the development of our robot. We aim to inspire FRC teams and provide valuable documentation of our process. We don’t have much to show yet (since kickoff is still a few days away), but here is a s…
cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 4 million users.

-Thanks

-Mike

FYI: FYI @Jernovak38 @jbrower17 @nathan_bui @NoahBui @MichaelCanfield @sachielfickel @yavin @JoshuaGeer

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T16:52:50.868Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":140.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496603,"topic_slug":"pulley-to-1-2-hex-shaft-backlash","display_username":"ben gates","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/product/1143N22","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":62}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38980,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"breh"},"post_url":"/t/pulley-to-1-2-hex-shaft-backlash/496603/2","custom_user_title":"breh","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566081,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T16:53:59.300Z","cooked":"

If possible, I would try to completely eliminate the hex/hex interface as they are really bad in terms of backlash.

Barring that, your next best bet is to use clamping hubs as the clamping action takes up all the play.

Baring the first two, the next best bet is to shim the hex. Shim opposite faces until the fit is tight, and it will significantly reduce (but not eliminate) the hex/hex backlash.

You also need to watch out for backlash in the maxplanetary output state and shim that too. There isn’t a facemount output (yet), so this hex/hex interface always comes with the gearbox.

It feels like you’re suggesting that we machine a part that has hex shaft inputs to connect to the max planetary and then have that part bolt to a 24T pulley?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T17:02:36.162Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":46.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496603,"topic_slug":"pulley-to-1-2-hex-shaft-backlash","display_username":"Mike Stitt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pulley-to-1-2-hex-shaft-backlash/496603/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566097,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T17:12:48.322Z","cooked":"

Retaining compound (green loctite) is another option.

In the world of FRC engineering at this point in the season I would go for the shim tape or retaining compound.

Future seasons may be worth exploring clamping hubs. This is very much a choose where to invest resources at this point in the season and your manufacturing capabilities.
